did.unittitle: Investigation Files of the Rapp-Coudert Committee (New York State Legislature)
did.abstract: The Rapp-Coudert Committee (New York State Joint Legislative Committee on the State Education System) was charged with investigating individuals and organizations with suspected radical ties in New York City public schools and colleges from 1940-1942. The collection consists of the Committee's investigation files including correspondence, interview notes and hearing transcripts; minutes; and copies of Communist, anti-war and civil liberties publications collected by the Committee in the course of investigations. Many files contain extensive notes on individuals under investigation, and include documentation on other persons suspected of ties to Communism.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Rapp-Coudert Committee (New York State Joint Legislative Committee on the State Education System) was charged with investigating individuals and organizations with suspected radical ties in New York City public schools and colleges from 1940-1942.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Microfilm (FILM R7860) of a collection owned by the New York State Archives: Series L0260, Investigation Files of the Rapp-Coudert Committee. The collection consists of 21 linear feet of the Committee's investigation files including correspondence, interview notes, hearing transcripts, minutes, and copies of Communist, anti-war and civil liberties publications collected by the Committee in the course of its investigations. Many files contain extensive notes on individuals under investigation, and include documentation on other persons suspected of ties to Communism.

NOTE: The finding aid produced by the New York State Archives is available via the URL below (a hard copy is available at the Tamiment Reference Desk). The finding aid is currently being revised by Tamiment staff to provide a more detailed description of the collection.
